meanings.definition: To move from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I will transfer the books to the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Can you transfer the files to the USB drive?
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to transfer the toy mouse to its bed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to transfer happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays transfer warmth to the earth.

meanings.definition: To convey or shift from one person or place to another.
meanings.sent1: Please transfer the message to your friend.
meanings.sent2: They will transfer the patient to a different hospital.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to transfer the coin from one hand to the other.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to transfer confidence to the team.
meanings.sent5: The wind can transfer pollen from one flower to another.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The transfer of goods between warehouses is efficient.
meanings.sent2: She completed the transfer of ownership paperwork.
meanings.sent3: The transfer of power from the old king to the new one was smooth.
meanings.sent4: The transfer of knowledge from teacher to student is essential.
meanings.sent5: The transfer of energy from the sun powers our planet.
